reviews.review_msg: Susan is a fabulous professor. She teaches dense material but finds a way to make it relevant and interesting. Expect a ton of reading and a lot of lively group discussion, attendance is mandatory. She is very helpful in office hours and really cares about her students. You will learn a lot and have a good time doing it.

Susan is my favourite teacher in the department, and I was glad to take another class with her. She is super approachable, kind, and willing to give students the push they need to help them succeed. Her lectures are always interesting and the four hours a week just fly by! Take a class with Susan, you won't regret it in the slightest.

Susan is amazing, and genuinely wants her students to do well and succeed. She is kind, inspiring, and makes learning relevant and fun. I could go on and on, but won't. Take a class with her; you will not regret it. The two hour seminars fly by!

Long class, but not Susan's fault.  She made the material really interesting and I looked forward to coming to class!  Lively, smart, open to students' viewpoints.  I appreciated the fact she assigned a range of readings outside the textbook.
Paul is smart but very strange.

Paul is an intelligent man and a fair marker. He actually looks forward to speaking with students on an individual basis. One question...How does everything in literature relate to Barry Humphries/Dame Edna? Take his class to find out!
'Peter'is a great human being, but needs to learn how to be more selective about what he says out loud before he could ever be a great teacher. The guy needs to get over Dame Edna!
spent more time talking about uninteresting personal life than literature

It was a difficult learning environment. He is very smart but bored by others who do not share his level of intelligence.  His lectures meander around the topic and constantly include anecdotes of his personal life.  He is insecure and constantly needs ego stroking.

Kind, welcoming, and always open to questions. Would recommend staying after class to go over questions or potential ideas for assignments, because she really puts in the effort to help you understand. Lectures were confusing at times, but discussions with her always helped clear them up.
One of my favourite profs at SFU

She is a very nice lady, but this class was extremely boring. 4 hours and she gives a 15-20 min break. Readings are extremely long and very boring. She's a pretty tough marker too, I usually get A's/B+ and ended up with a low B. Super kind lady though, I  just feel like the content of the course was extremely boring.

She seems very passionate about what she's teaching and tries her best to stimulate a class discussion.  If you ask a question, she is very adamant of answering your question as best as she can, (Students often would ask extremely complex questions and she will keep going through it with you until your question is answered to your satisfaction.)

IM DYING FROM BOREDOM IN THIS CLASS. The material is dry and the 4 hour class is dryer. I gave up reading after the first week. The grading for paper was super tough, and I only show up for class because I have to (you lose grades if you don't show up). I can't wait til this semester is over. Also she doesn't give hourly breaks, only 10 minutes.

She is obviously very passionate about the subject matter and very knowledgeable, but she does not seem to have any sense of clarity when explaining the material. Hardly anyone talks in the class because her questions are so convoluted. She is open to answering questions; however her answers are often just as complicated as what she said originally
A great prof for upper-levels students who want to challenge themselves and really get into literary criticism.  Very approachable.
Extremely intelligent and engaging, but yes she's a toughie, will challenge you
